page.title: 01ASHTON-IN-MAKERFIELD.
page.content: Ashton-in-Makerfield is on the outskirts on Wigan. It is a small town but busy and the M6 runs through, and there is a turn off leading to Liverpool Road, because of this there is a lot of traffic. The High Street in Ashton-in-Makerfield is Gerard Street which has a lot of bus stops and supermarkets, like Kwik Save and Greenways, and there is a market held every Tuesday and Saturday. There are three secondary schools and many primary schools. There are lots of youth clubs and lots of Labour and Conservative clubs, and churches. The crime rate is low and we have our own Police station. There are two free newspapers the Wigan Reporter and the Wigan leader. We are in the county of Greater Manchester.
